anchoring.anchoring_output:
Enhanced reasoning process:
MUD, or Multi-User Dungeon, is a type of online multiplayer role-playing game that originated in the late 1970s and early 1980s. It is considered one of the earliest forms of virtual worlds and played a significant role in the development of the massively multiplayer online role-playing game (MMORPG) genre. MUDs are typically text-based and involve players interacting in a virtual environment, engaging in role-playing, combat, exploration, and socializing. The genre of MUD encompasses elements of role-playing games, interactive fiction, and online chat, creating a unique and immersive gaming experience.

Based on this understanding, the genre of MUD is best categorized as a role-playing game (RPG), given its focus on player-driven storytelling, character development, and interactive gameplay within a virtual world.

Answer:
Role-playing game (RPG)
